intro: Euphrasia pectinata subsp. pectinata, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, hairless stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are borne in dense spikes. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic or hemiparasitic species.
